purpleculture_pinyin:
lǒng
ridge between fields; row of crops; grave mound
гребень между полями; ряд культур; могильный холм
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 垄)
Pictophonetic: 龍 indicates the sound; 土 (earth) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
壟斷 [ lǒng duàn ]: to enjoy market dominance; to monopolize
壟溝 [ lǒng gōu ]: furrow (agriculture)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 龍 [ lóng ] dragon; symbol of the emperor
    • 土 [ tǔ ] soil, earth; items made of earth
heisig_chinese_memo: Why go through the trouble of making a raised path between fields to separate your land from the neighbors.  Just have your loyal dragon fly around in your territory to represent the border.
Ru_trainchinese: lǒng: (сущ) насыпь, гряда между полями
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Why go through the trouble of making a raised path between fields to separate your land from the neighbors.  Just have your loyal dragon fly around in your territory to represent the border.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " earth ", " dragon " sound. The characters of the Warring States Period have an up-and-down structure, and the Xiaozhuan becomes a left-right structure, which is called "垅". " Ridge " with the " ridge ", the original meaning is raised grave. "Shuowen": "Long, Qiulong. From the soil, the sound of the dragon." Paragraph note: "The taller is the Qiulong." "Dialect": "Mound, the tomb between the Qin and Jin Dynasties...or the ridge. "For example, "Book of Rites. "Qu Li Shang": "Suitable for tombs do not climb the ridges, help burials must be embarrassed." Zheng Xuan's note: "ridges, graves." " Stained " refers to the rope that draws the coffin. Another example is "Historical Records. "Tian Dan Biography": "The Yan army dug the tombs and burned people to death."

" Ridge " means " long ", which means Longshan. Such as "Yuefu Poetry Collection. Horizontally blowing tunes. "The Song of the King of Langya": "Wei River comes from the ridge and floats under the Wei Bridge." Gao Shi of the Tang Dynasty "Denglong": "The ridge head is far away, and the water is distributed on the ridge."

" Ridge " is extended to refer to high hills and mountains, such as Li Duan in the Tang Dynasty "Send Ma Zunshi": "Go straight up to the haze and raise your hand, go back to the hill and ridge to grieve yourself." Northern Song Wang Anshi "Send Wu Long Picture to Know Jiangning": "The eaves are sitting behind the clouds. Thousands of miles, Bo Lung found the green at first."

" Ridge " also means field boundaries and ridges. "Ji Yun. "Swollen rhyme": "Lian, Tian Di." Such as "Han. "Chen Sheng Xiangji Biography": "(Chen Sheng) stopped ploughing on the ridge, and felt melancholy for a long time." Yan Shi's ancient note: "On the ridge, it is the height of the field." It means that Chen Sheng stopped farming and walked on the stalk, feeling melancholy. long time. Another example is "Qi Min Yao Shu. Garden fence": "Every farming, three ridges, two reds in the middle."

"Monopoly" originally refers to an independent highland. It is also referred to as "Dragon Break", which means "Mencius. "Gongsun Chouxia": "If you have a lowly husband, you must ask the dragon to break and climb it, looking at the left and right, but not the city." Zhao Qi's note: "Dragon is broken, the one who is high is also high; Seeing the advantage of the market, take it for nothing.” Refers to standing on a high hill and visiting left and right in order to collect goods that can be obtained at high profit in the market. The latter extension means control and exclusive (interest). For example, Yang Wanli of the Southern Song Dynasty, "Guan Anren Supervising Tax for the Second Son": "Is it possible for Guan to collect taxes? What is the desire for monopoly."
humanum_short_description_en: From " earth ", " dragon " sound. " Ridge " with the " ridge ", the original meaning is raised grave.
humanum_full_description:
從「土」，「龍」聲。戰國文字為上下結構，小篆變為左右結構，作「壠」。「壟」同「壠」，本義是高起的墳墓。《說文》：「壠，丘壠也。从土，龍聲。」段注：「高者曰丘壠。」《方言》：「冢，秦晉之間謂之墳……或謂之壠。」如《禮記．曲禮上》：「適墓不登壟，助葬必執紼。」鄭玄注：「壟，冢也。」「紼」指牽引靈柩的繩索。又如《史記．田單列傳》：「燕軍盡掘壟墓，燒死人。」

　　「壟」通作「隴」，即隴山。如《樂府詩集．橫吹曲辭．琅琊王歌辭》：「渭水從壟來，浮遊渭橋下。」唐代高適〈登壟〉：「壟頭遠行客，壟上分流水。」

　　「壟」引申指高丘、高山，如唐代李端〈送馬尊師〉：「直上煙霞空舉手，回經丘壟自傷心。」北宋王安石〈送吳龍圖知江寧〉：「茅檐坐隔雲千里，柏壟初抽翠一尋。」

　　「壟」也表示田界、田埂。《集韻．腫韻》：「壠，田埒。」如《漢書．陳勝項籍傳》：「（陳勝）輟耕之壟上，悵然甚久。」顏師古注：「壟上，謂田中之高處。」意謂陳勝停止耕作，走到田梗上，惆悵了很久。又如《齊民要術．園籬》：「凡耕，作三壟，中間相去各二赤。」

　　「壟斷」本指獨立的高地，亦作「龍斷」，語出《孟子．公孫丑下》：「有賤丈夫焉，必求龍斷而登之，以左右望，而罔市利。」趙岐注：「龍斷，謂堁斷而高者也；左右占視，望見市中有利，罔羅而取之。」指站在高丘上左右探望，以網羅市集中可獲取高利的貨物。後引申表示把持、獨佔（利益）。如南宋楊萬里〈送次公子之官安仁監稅〉：「關征豈得已，壟斷欲何為。」
humanum_short_description: 從「土」，「龍」聲。「壟」同「壠」，本義是高起的墳墓。

Pictophonetic: 龍 indicates the sound; 土 (earth) conveys the meaning.

    • 土 [ tǔ ] soil, earth; items made of earth

壟溝 [ lǒng gōu ]: furrow (agriculture)

壟字的基本解释

壟
lǒng
见“垄”。

壟字的汉语字典释义

[①]［lǒng］
［《廣韻》力踵切，上腫，來。］
亦作“壠1”。“垄1”的繁体字。
(1)坟墓。
(2)高丘，高地。
(3)田埂，田间稍稍高起的小路。
(4)成行种植农作物的土埂。
(5)像垄的东西。
(6)地积单位。
(7)通“隴”。

壟字的康熙字典解释

【丑集中】【土字部】　壟； 康熙笔画：19； 页码：页242第05
【廣韻】力踵切【集韻】【韻會】魯勇切，?音隴。冢也。【揚子·方言】秦晉之閒，冢謂之壟。【禮·曲禮】適墓不登壟。　又田中高處。【史記·?涉世家】輟耕而之壟上。　又【集韻】盧東切，音籠。【東方朔·七諫】修往古以行恩兮，封比干之丘壟。與下同字叶。　亦作龍。通作隴。

壟字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
壟字的起名意思

暂无。

lǒng
See "ridge".
Ridge
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［lǒng］
["Guangyun" has a heel cut and a swollen top, come on. ]
Also known as "Long 1". Traditional characters for "Rong 1".
(1) Tomb.
(2) High hills, high ground.
(3) Field ridge, a slightly elevated path in the field.
(4) Soil ridges where crops are planted in rows.
(5) Things like ridges.
(6) Plot unit.
(7) Link "Long".
Ridge

She Family] quit farming and land on the ridge.　[Jiyun] Lu Dongqie, sound cage. [Dongfangshuo·Seven Admonitions] Cultivating the ancients to live gracefully, and seal the hills and ridges of Bigan. Same word as below.　It is also a dragon. Pass for Long.
